title: France national rugby union team - Wikipedia
snippet: After the 2023 Rugby World Cup, Ghezal, Labit and Giroud left the France coaching staff and were replaced respectively by Stade Français forwards coach Laurent Sempéré, former international centre Patrick Arlettaz and Nicolas Jeanjean, who became the head of high performance.

title: France rugby union team: Fixtures, squad and head coach
snippet: The top tryscorer in the Six Nations in both 2022 and 2023, Bordeaux Begles wing Penaud is a gamechanger for this France side who time and time again is on hand to apply the finishing touches for Fabien Galthe's side. title: Fabien Galthié - Wikipedia
snippet: In 2019 he became an assistant coach of the France national team, and became head coach in 2020. In 2022, he led France to a Six Nations Grand Slam. In 2025, he led France to a Six Nations Championship. Born in Cahors, Galthié began his career at a club in Tournefeuille, before joining Colomiers. He made his international debut for France against Romania in June 1991. He was called into France's 1991 Rugby World Cup squad, replacing the injured Pierre Berbizier.

title: France rugby coach: Who has led the men's team over the years? - Rugby World
snippet: A country flush with rugby talent, the nation is yet to win a Rugby World Cup, but has all the potential to lift the Webb Ellis Cup, not least thanks to current start player Antoine Dupont.
